DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether provide ventilatory assistance prior umbilical cord clamp influence occurrence intraventricular hemorrhage ( IVH ) extremely preterm ( EPT ) infant , compare standard care provide ventilatory assistance cord clamping .
DOC.brief_title: VentFirst : A Multicenter RCT Assisted Ventilation During Delayed Cord Clamping Extremely Preterm Infants
DOC.detailed_description: 940 newborn gestation 23 wks 0 day 28 wks 6 day Randomized Standard arm ( delay cord clamp 30 second , 60 second breathe spontaneously ) VentFirst arm ( receive CPAP PPV 30 sec 120 sec ) . Primary outcome lack IVH 7-10 day head ultrasound .
DOC.criteria: 23 0/7 28 6/7 week gestation delivery . Lifethreatening condition fetus ( e.g . severe hydrops , lethal chromosomal abnormality , severe congenital malformation ) Suspected severe fetal anemia Monochorionic monoamniotic twin Multiple gestation great twin Decision make comfort care Medical emergency necessitate emergency delivery ( e.g . complete placental abruption ) Obstetrician Neonatology concern inappropriateness study intervention base maternal fetal factor .
